unit_learning_outcomes.description: Explain the key iterative steps involved in building a model (business understanding, data understanding and preparation, modelling, evaluation, communication and deployment).
Describe the various stages in data understanding and preparation and apply these skills within the context of practical problems.
Use a range of perspectives (statistical techniques and measures, business context and objectives etc.) to evaluate the appropriateness of a model.
Communicate modelling results to a range of business decision making audiences, taking into account the audience’s needs and relating findings back to the original business objectives.
Compare predictive modelling techniques to select an appropriate method for a stated situation and perform predictive modelling for a given set of data.

non_scheduled_learning_activities.description: Further article readings will form part of the learning resources to supplement lecture notes.
Preparation for lectures and various assessment items.

assessments.description: Students will be required to write up a report (word limit of up to 5000 words) based on a project.
Students will work on two individual case studies.
The final examination will be closed book, a three-hour written paper with ten minutes reading time, to be held during the University Examination period.

data.unit_offering_text:
Session 2, Weekday attendance, North Ryde
Session 2, Special circumstances

academic_org.value: Department of Actuarial Studies and Business Analytics

data.description: This unit covers tools and techniques in data analytics. Students will be taught how to apply these skills in a range of business environments and will be able to contribute to all stages of developing solutions to analytical problems across multiple industries or domains. This unit has a focus on practical application using a variety of real-life case studies. Students gaining a grade of credit or higher in this unit are eligible for exemption from the Data Analytics Principles subject of the Actuaries Institute.
data.title: Actuarial Data Analytics
